title: These dragon changes are amazing!
body:
> 2nd Dragon now gives a tower burn.

Because the first thing I thought was that people are having a really hard time killing towers right now. 

> 4th Dragon now gives defense vs turrets.

Because you know, towers hit really, really hard and the losing team needs even more incentive to just give up and call it quits right?


While we're on the subject of dumb changes, why don't we make Alistar easier to play by making it impossible for even Joe-Dumbfuck to screw up. 
Because who needs skill?

And let's give these massively unforgiving assassins an item that forgives them if they screw up and fail to kill someone, leaving them at a tiny slither of health. Well those days of just falling short are over because now even assassins can fuck up and still be rewarded! Like people needed more reasons to play Zed!

Good job Riot! Another flawless patch!

/end sarcasm.

And now we wait for the assassin (More specifically Zed) fanboys to line up to take it in turns pissing into my mailbox.

These changes ALONE are bad for the game but they do pave the way for positive tower changes without the risk of bringing back a major stall meta. (which RIOT hates) 

In theory if they buff towers now. A team will have reasonable means to stall. Baron will still be a major threat to this as the largest siege breaker. But if they also allow the opposition to get four dragons they will also face significant and permanent difficulty with further stalling.   Considering a fourth dragon is not only (normally) fairly late into the game but also presents four opportunities to be contested / stolen / taken this is fair.   Stronger stalling and comeback opportunities, but a balance to ensure other teams aren't just completely walled off from any possible victory.

Many people will explain to you about how hard it is to lane against him. I will not. Instead let me point something else out. 
The majority of the time, if you are a midlaner (mage or not) you're goal in a team-fight is to kill their ADC. Since ADC's try to position themselves near the back line, you often have to over extend yourself in order to accomplish this, most mages don't have a strong form of escape/ gapcloser. Zed has both. 
He can very quickly use his W to gapclose into their backline, and then press R to ult their ADC, becoming untargetable and leaving a shadow behind. When he reappears a quick press of Q and E will almost insure that the ADC will die, or be so low that they have to back right now, and Zed just has to press R again to blink back to where he ulted from. 
It's kinda ludicrous how easy it is to play him

I see what you are talking about, and I hope I don't sound cocky, but this is a low elo problem. In Plat+, Zed is focused first. In any teamfight, Zed is always pinned down to ensure the ADC's safety. Also the ADC has QSS to ensure that he survives Zed's ult so that puts Zed in a bad spot. 

Now imagine Zed ults and ADC with an Ali supp. He gets instantly knocked up and destroyed. In low elo, Zeds are feared (I have no idea why). They think all Zed players are really good but in reality they are below average. So this is the problem. Individual skill in low elo is a factor causing people there to say that Zed is OP.

I don't care if its just a low elo problem. Low elos have WAY more players in it then the higher ones and I think it is unfair to say that just because we aren't high enough rank that we don't deserve any recognition or respect when it comes to matters like balance. 
Zed's are feared in low elo I think mostly because of the knowledge base that each player has. For the most part, players know how to play their champions...and that's about it. When it comes to countering other champions they are left a little blank. Do you know how much damage a single Zed can wreck in a game where no one knows how to counter him? It's insane. Also there have been plenty of people smurfing with Zed's just to be a dick and wreck shop. This doesn't help the fear factor at all. 

Anyways, the short of it is #BronzeLivesMatter

I like that hashtag xD

Now on a more serious note, you can't remove power from Zed just because people don't know how to deal with him. There are tutorials and guides that outline how you defeat Zed. There are champions and items that help you counter Zed. If you want to get out of low elo (which is what every bronze/silver/Gold 3-5 player wants), then you have to put in time to learn how to counter the champ or just ban him. It's easier now since everyone except from the first 2 pick get a ban. 

Note that I'm not saying low elo should be disregarded, I'm just saying that nerfing Zed because people don't want to put in time to learn about him is wrong. They are better off nerfing Rengar.
